admin.configeditor.confignotfound: The configuration file for the config editor could not be found
admin.configeditor.entername: Enter the name of the new world:
admin.configeditor.invalidinput: Your input is either too short or incorrect
admin.configeditor.title: Config editor
admin.configeditor.warningNoDefaultValues: The default configuration could not be found.
admin.configeditor.worldcreated: The world has been created. You can now configure it like any other world.

admin.login.default: Your password is still the default one! (editme)

admin.world.managePlayers.name: Player name
admin.world.managePlayers.villageHandleQuestion: What should happen with the villages of the player?

buildingBarracks.description: In the barracks you can recruit infantry. The higher its level the faster the recruitment of troops will be finished.
buildingBarracks.name: Barracks

buildingChurch.description: The church gives all the villages in the nearby area belief. When a village has belief, its troops fight at 100% effectiveness instead of 50%.
buildingChurch.name: Church

buildingChurchF.description: The first church gives all the villages in the nearby area belief. When a village has belief, its troops fight at 100% effectiveness instead of 50%. The first church is built by default in your first village, and can only be built once.
buildingChurchF.name: First church

buildingFarm.description: The farm supplies your workers and troops with food. Without extending your farm your village cannot grow. The higher its level the more villagers can be supplied.
buildingFarm.name: Farm

buildingGarage.description: In the workshop you can produce rams and catapults. The higher its level the faster the recruitment will be finished.
buildingGarage.name: Workshop

buildingHide.description: Resources in your hiding place cannot be plundered by your enemies. The bigger it is, the more it can hold. There is no place to hide your troops though. Even your enemies' scouts cannot spot the resources hidden in your hiding place.
buildingHide.name: Hiding place
buildingHide.marketPlunder: Offers on the market can be plundered even if the resources fit into your hiding place.

buildingIron.description: In the iron mine your workers dig the war-crucial iron. The higher its level the more iron is produced.
buildingIron.name: Iron mine

buildingMain.ajaxBuild: The building order was successfully queued.
buildingMain.cannotBuild: Can't be built in this village
buildingMain.changeOrder: Here you can change the order of your building queue by dragging them to the desired location with your mouse.
buildingMain.description: In the village headquarters you can construct new buildings or upgrade existing ones. The higher the level of your headquarters, the faster the constructions will be finished. As soon as your Village Headquarters are upgraded to level 15, you will be able to demolish buildings in this village.
buildingMain.fullyDestroyed: Building can not be demolished any further
buildingMain.name: Village Headquarters
buildingMain.nameTooShort: The village name has to contain at least 3 characters.
buildingMain.orderSuccess: The building order was successfully queued.
buildingMain.queueBuild: Assignments added to the building queue will cost more. Do you still want to add this assignment?
buildingMain.queueInfo: Additional cost for the next assignment in the building queue: {x}
buildingMain.queueText: There is no refund for the additional costs that were charged for putting a building into the building queue
buildingMain.storageTooSmallQueue: Warehouse too small to build in queue.
buildingMain.tooFewResQueue: Not enough resources available to add assignment to building queue.

buildingMarket.description: On the market you can trade with other players.
buildingMarket.name: Market

buildingPlace.description: On the rally point your fighters meet. Here you can command your armies.
buildingPlace.name: Rally point
buildingPlace.damagedWall: The wall has been damaged and downgraded from level {before} to level {after}
buildingPlace.damagedBuilding: The building has been damaged and downgraded from level {before} to level {after}
buildingPlace.errorNoTarget: You need to enter the x and y coordinates of the destination

buildingSmith.description: In the smithy you can research and improve weapons. Upgrading the smithy allows the research of better weapons and decreases the research time.
buildingSmith.name: Smithy

buildingSnob.coinMinted: You have minted a gold coin
buildingSnob.description: In the academy you can educate noblemen. They will help you conquer other villages.
buildingSnob.name: Academy
buildingSnob.alreadyCreated: Already saved for the limit of noblemen {x}
buildingSnob.amountCreatable: Number of nobleman that can be educated
buildingSnob.stillMissing: Still missing for the limit of noblemen {x}
buildingSnob.coinHint: To educate more noblemen you have to mint gold coins. The more gold coins you have, the more villages you can have.
buildingSnob.limitReached: No more noblemen can be produced

buildingStable.description: In the stables you can recruit cavalry. The higher its level the faster the recruitment of the troops will be finished.
buildingStable.name: Stable

buildingStatue.description: At the statue the villagers render homage to your paladin. If your paladin dies you can appoint one of your fighters to become the new paladin.
buildingStatue.name: Statue
buildingStatue.findingProgress: Progress until finding the next item:
buildingStatue.inventoryDes: Items are effective only for units joined by a Paladin equipped with that particular item.
buildingStatue.palaExists: Each player may only have one paladin
buildingStatue.palaNameError: Name must be between 3 and 50 characters
buildingStatue.cancelInfo: ninety percent of the used resources are refunded to your storage unit
buildingStatue.allItemsFound: Your Palading already found all items.

buildingStone.description: In the clay pit your workers extract clay, which is important for new buildings. The higher its level the more clay is produced.
buildingStone.name: Clay pit

buildingStorage.description: The warehouse stores your resources. The higher its level the more resources can be stored.
buildingStorage.name: Warehouse
buildingStorage.isFull: Warehouse is full. No more resources can be stored!

buildingWall.description: The wall defends your village against your enemies' troops. The higher its level the better the basic defense of your village. It also increases the defensive strength the troops stationed in the village.
buildingWall.name: Wall

buildingWood.description: Outside of your village in the dark forests your lumberjacks cut massive trees to produce wood in the timber camp, which is needed for buildings and weapons. The higher its level the more wood is produced.
buildingWood.name: Timber camp

createVillage.description: In which area would you like your new village to be placed?
createVillage.noRestart: You can't create more new villages.
createVillage.title: Create new village

game.ally.alreadyexists: This ID is already being used by another tribe.
game.ally.confirmLeave: Are you sure you want to leave your tribe?
game.ally.defaultAnnouncement: For questions please contact  [player={owner}][/player][br][br][i]This text may be changed by the tribal aristocracy.[/i]
game.ally.defaultDescription: If you have questions please contact [player={owner}][/player].[br][br][i]This text can be changed by the tribal diplomats.[/i]
game.ally.enter: To join a tribe, you must have an invitation from that tribe.
game.ally.disbandConfirm: Do you really want to disband your tribe?

game.ally.diplomaty.alreadyrelation: There is already a relationship to this tribe.
game.ally.diplomaty.head: On this page your relations with other tribes are administered. The settings are non-binding within the game, but villages will be coloured accordingly on the map. The status is visible only to tribe members and may be changed by tribal diplomats only.

game.ally.events.3: The tribe is now allied with {toTribe}.
game.ally.events.4: The tribe now has a NAP with {toTribe}.
game.ally.events.5: The tribe is now enemies with {toTribe}.
game.ally.events.8: The invitation to {toPlayer} has been withdrawn by {fromPlayer}.
game.ally.events.9: {fromPlayer} changed the privileges and title of {toPlayer}.
game.ally.events.12: {fromPlayer} changed the description of the tribe.
game.ally.events.666: The tribe has canceled their relationship with {toTribe}.

game.ally.forum.author: Author
game.ally.forum.confirmDeleteThread: Are you sure, you want to delete this thread?
game.ally.forum.confirmDeleteThreads: Are you sure, you want to delete this threads?
game.ally.forum.question: question
game.ally.forum.title: title

game.ally.forum.admin.modifyableOrder: You can change the order of the folder-entries by dragging them to the wished target destination (Use your mouse)
game.ally.forum.admin.notYetConfirmed: This tribe has not yet agreed to sharing the forum

game.ally.invite.name: Name
game.ally.invite.notagain: This player has already received an invitation.

game.ally.members.permissionDesc: Here you can set the privileges for the players in your tribe. The duke privileges should only be given to players you know VERY well and that you can fully trust.
game.ally.members.founderDesc: Sets status to duke. A duke possesses all tribal privileges, can disband or rename the tribe, set the homepage and chat-channel, administer the tribal forum and name other members dukes.
game.ally.members.leadDesc: Barons can set privileges and titles of other members and disband members. They can receive other privileges as well that can be given by the dukes.
game.ally.members.title: title

game.groups.erroralready: A group with this name already exists.

game.menu.ally.iNew: New posts in the tribe forum
game.menu.ally.iOld: No new posts in the tribe forum
game.menu.ally.title: Tribe

game.overview.cancelBuild: Are you sure you want to cancel the assignment?

game.report.subject: Subject
game.report.title: Reports
game.report.noDefInfo:
None of your troops have returned.
No information about the strength of your enemy's army could be collected

game.title.firstVillage: To the first village of this group

game.train.desc: In this overview you can recruit all types of units if you have constructed the required buildings and researched the needed technologies.

game.train.queue.cancelBack: * (ninety percent of the used resources are refunded to your storage unit)
game.train.queue.cancelSure: Are you sure you want to cancel all recruitment orders?
game.train.queue.drag: Here you can change the order of your queue by dragging them to the desired location with your mouse.

index.title: TWLan - Tribal Wars LAN Version
index.wrongIP: TWLan may only be player in your local network!
index.loginTitle: Hello {user}, on which world would you like to play?

join.registerDeactivated: Joining this world has been disabled.
join.title: Join
join.worldFull: The player limit for this world has been reached.

knightItemsDesc.archer: Increases the offensive fighting power of your archers by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.axe: Increases the offensive fighting power of your axemen by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.catapult: Increases the damage by catapults by %special
knightItemsDesc.heavy: Increases the offensive fighting power of your heavy cavalry by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.light: Increases the offensive fighting power of your light cavalry by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.marcher: Increases the offensive fighting power of your mounted archers by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.ram: Increases the damage caused by rams by %special
knightItemsDesc.snob: The nobleman lowers the loyalty by at least %special.
knightItemsDesc.spear: Increases the offensive fighting power of your spear fighters by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.
knightItemsDesc.spy: Scouts can see units from the scouted village that are not at home.
knightItemsDesc.sword: Increases the offensive fighting power of your swordsmen by %atk and the defensive fighting power  by  %def.

register.name: User name
register.nameTaken: The requested user name is already being used!
register.nameTooLong: The name may not exceed 50 characters!
register.nameTooShort: The name has to contain at least 4 characters!
register.passwordEqualsName: The password may not be the same as your user name!
register.passwordTooLong: The password may not exceed 50 characters!
register.passwordTooShort: The password has to contain at least 4 characters!
register.passwordsDontMatch: The password must be entered twice, and be exactly the same.
register.title: Register

sidWrong.content: Your session has expired. Please log in again at {link}.
sidWrong.max: You're not a part of the 25 players of this world, therefore you can't play on this world.
sidWrong.title: Session expired

unitArcher.desc: The archer is a very effective defensive unit. Their arrows destroy even the hardest armor.
unitArcher.name: Archer

unitAxe.desc: The axeman is a strong offensive unit. They easily forget to protect themselves though.
unitAxe.name: Axeman

unitCatapult.desc: Catapults are especially good in destroying your enemies' buildings.
unitCatapult.name: Catapult

unitHeavy.desc: The heavy cavalry are your elite troops. The noble knights have hardened weapons and strong armor.
unitHeavy.name: Heavy cavalry

unitKnight.desc: The noble paladin protects you and your allies' villages from enemy attacks. Each player may only have one paladin.
unitKnight.name: Paladin

unitLight.desc: The light cavalry is a good offensive unit. One of its advantages is its speed.
unitLight.name: Light cavalry

unitMarcher.desc: The mounted archer is especially useful to disable your enemies archers on the Walls.
unitMarcher.name: Mounted archer

unitRam.desc: Rams support your troops in your attacks as it damages your enemies' Wall.
unitRam.name: Ram

unitSnob.desc: A nobleman will reduce the loyalty of your enemies' villages. If its loyalty falls under 0 you conquer that village. The costs for each nobleman increase with every conquered village and every nobleman that is available or in production.
unitSnob.name: Nobleman

unitSpear.desc: The spear fighter is the most basic unit. It is good in defending against cavalry and to start plundering other villages.
unitSpear.name: Spear fighter

unitSpy.desc: The scout creeps into your enemies' villages to get valuable information.
unitSpy.name: Scout

unitSword.desc: The swordsman is a relatively slow unit effective as defense especially against infantry.
unitSword.name: Swordsman
